Articles.Content:
So I thought, in order to make asparagus more realistic, why not have realistic caps on fuel transfer between tanks.

As in, the amount of fuel pumped per second has a cap at some constant multiplied by the tube's diameter and the max pressure it can handle. So that way more realistic fuel pipes are necessary, or least a larger number of fuel pipes in order to increase the volume that can be transferred per second.

The amount of fuel that can be transferred per second is ridiculous atm. Fuel pipes could be more varied, could be larger in diameter, stronger, or thicker to account for larger pressure given by bigger tanks. And of course, using science, they could be upgraded to allow for larger tanks to give faster/higher pressure fuel transfer.

This way, if you want to asparagus, you need to give a little more thought than JUST staging order.

There is NO reason to make it more 'realistic', other than 'hur dur it's realistic'

THIS IS A GAME.

It's not a simulator

"This is a game" is not a good argument for anything. Games are a form of art and entertainment, and they can be used to express at least as wide variety of things as books and movies.

The fuel lines are silly and unbelievable. If somebody can figure out a simple way to fix them, it would make KSP a better game.

Learn what a suggestion means. Do you need a link to a dictionary?

There is a reason to make it more realistic - nearly everyone who plays it focuses on realism at some point in time. You don't like that? well keep it to yourself. Your selfish prerogatives are NOT EVER going to direct the development of a game when you are so far sunken into the minority that you're starting to step in the **** that is your personality.
